metadata.title: CVE-2019-14835 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - high
metadata.description:
A buffer overflow flaw was found, in versions from 2.6.34 to 5.2.x, in theway Linux kernel's vhost functionality that translates virtqueue buffers toIOVs, logged the buffer descriptors during migration. A privileged guestuser able to pass descriptors with invalid length to the host whenmigration is underway, could use this flaw to increase their privileges onthe host.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-14835` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-164.192
linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-164.192
linux-image-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-164.192
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-164.192
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-164.192
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-164.192
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-164.192
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-164.192
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-164.192
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-64-generic - 4.15.0-64.73~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-64-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-64.73~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-64-lowlatency - 4.15.0-64.73~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-64-generic - 4.15.0-64.73~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-64-lowlatency - 4.15.0-64.73~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1058-kvm - 4.4.0-1058.65
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-aws - 4.4.0-1094.105
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1050-aws - 4.15.0-1050.52~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1059-azure - 4.15.0-1059.64
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1044-gcp - 4.15.0-1044.46
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1025-oracle - 4.15.0-1025.28~16.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-164.192').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-64.73~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1058.65').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1094.105').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1050.52~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1059.64').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1044.46').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1025.28~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1122.131').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1126.132').
